security: This dispatch details operational activities and intelligence gathering methods related to Cuban exile groups. Disclosing the names of contacts, methods of information gathering, and operational details of the DRE (Directorio Revolucionario Estudiantil) could jeopardize ongoing operations and endanger individuals involved. Specifically, 'Since close relations are maintained by the JRAVE Station and the DRE, no attempt was made to press the source for naves and addresses, etc., as this information can be obtained in subsequent outside debriefings' indicates sensitive operational collaboration.
summary: A dispatch from Chief, Task Force W to Chief of Station, JM/WAVE, transmitting CIA reports and an index related to UFGA/Operational matters, specifically regarding the DRE (Directorio Revolucionario Estudiantil) activities and interviews with Cuban sources.
summary_one_paragraph: This secret dispatch, dated April 16, 1962, is from the Chief of Task Force W to the Chief of Station at JM/WAVE, concerning UFGA/Operational matters. It transmits CIA reports (numbers 134 through 149, and 156) with an attached index, covering the activities and interviews related to the DRE (Directorio Revolucionario Estudiantil). One report details an interview with Jose Antonio Sacens, a former member of the DR and DRE chief in Santiago de Cuba, who provided information on the DRE's organization, arms, and contacts within Cuba, as well as KUTUBE-type intelligence.
title: UFGA/Operational-Transmittal of CIA Reports
